intro: Brachystelma mortonii, commonly known as the Morton's dwarf ice plant, is a succulent species native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy, water-storing leaves and vibrant, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its small, erect stems and pale green to blue-gray foliage help it conserve moisture. Brachystelma mortonii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and resilience in dry climates.
